def masked_wordcloud(text, mask):
    wordcloud = WordCloud(background_color='white',
                        stopwords = STOPWORDS,
                        max_words = 15000,
                        max_font_size = 86, 
                        random_state = 42,
                        mask = mask)
    wordcloud.generate(text)
    figure_size=(24.0,16.0)
    plt.figure(figsize=figure_size)
    plt.imshow(wordcloud)
    plt.axis('off')
    plt.show()

# About
You have probably seen the images filled with lots of words of different sizes and colors - this technique is called "Word Cloud" and is a popular way to present the frequency or the word occurrences in some text corpus. This kernel is a mini-tutorial on how to generate one with Python with few lines of code.
source.dc229e2c: Define a helper method to draw a wordcloud out of text
source.4d31e68c: Please pay attention to the STOPWORDS parameter that allows to exclude some common words like 'the', 'a', 'he' from the result, as they occur frequently in any kind of text and provide no useful information.
